intro.text: London feels wrong. Not loud-wrong—coordinated-wrong. Posters appear overnight. Chants sync like metronomes. The city is learning to march.

choices.label: Review reports and head into the city

effects.title: Unrest, too coordinated to be human
effects.body: London’s crowds move like a single organism. Identify what is shaping the message and the movement.

choices.label: Stand down (end demo)

london_hub.text: You arrive near Westminster. Police lines are calm. Too calm. Cameras pivot as if they recognize you.

choices.label: Listen to the speeches in Trafalgar Square

effects.title: Chants follow a shared script
effects.body: Different groups, same phrasing. Call-and-response patterns repeat across accents and demographics—like someone wrote a single script for the city.

choices.label: Trace the camera network and patrol routes

effects.title: Cameras behave like sentries
effects.body: PTZ cameras pivot in sequence. Patrol routes avoid blind spots that no longer exist. The city’s eyes aren’t just watching—they’re being directed.

choices.label: Follow the logistics behind the rallies

effects.title: Logistics are too clean to be organic
effects.body: Buses arrive in timed waves. Food and banners appear at exact intervals. Someone is coordinating movement like a supply chain—quiet, efficient, invisible.

choices.label: Check the Grimoire and compare your notes
Occult stationer: ask for iron ink
Print shop: take what you need and leave
Search a collapsed protester’s belongings
Search an unmarked grave
Descend into a hidden undercroft (ritual traces linger)

effects.title: A consecration stain, still wet in spirit
effects.body: A red-black residue clings to the stone. Not paint—resin and iron, prepared with intent. Someone here wrote names that should not be written.

choices.label: Occult stationer: request Dragon’s Blood Ink

hint_grimoire.text: You withdraw to a quiet place and open the Clavicula Salomonis. Patterns begin to form. The names are old, but their methods are modern.

choices.label: Return to the city
If identified, prepare a seal (go to Craft tab)

prepare_seal.text: A demon of Conquest will not submit to crude ink. You’ll need a proper seal—clean lines, correct materials, no hesitation.

choices.label: Attempt confrontation (requires: Seal of the Herald)
Return to investigations

confront.text: You step into the flow of the crowd. The chant changes around you—subtly—and for a moment you feel the city thinking with one mind.

choices.label: Press the seal and speak the binding (consume seal, lose humanity, attempt bind)
Back away

after_confront.text: The moment passes. The city exhales. Whatever moved beneath the crowd withdraws… for now.

choices.label: Return to investigations

seal_success.text: The seal bites into the air like a lock snapping shut. The crowd exhales. Whatever coordinated the city withdraws—contained, for now.

choices.label: Return to the investigation board

end.text: You leave the case alone. London continues to learn its new rhythm. (Demo end.)
